mlBioNets 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • mlBioNets
    • my-vignette

    Reference

    All functions

    T_collapse()

    T_collapse

    TaxGroup()

    Identifies the membership of a node to a certain higher-ranking taxon.

    abs_mat()

    This function assigns colors to the nodes based on their abundance at the specified taxonomic level.

    cor_degree_abs()

    This function graphs the Pearson correlation between degree and abundance.

    ctr_df()

    Creates a data.frame with the degree of each layer's nodes.

    ctr_g()

    Colors the nodes of a network according to their centrality.

    ctr_ml()

    Colors the nodes according to their centrality.

    diff_nodes_graph()

    Identifies the most abundant taxa and recognizes which nodes have significant differences between their abundances (red) and which ones don't (blue).

    g_abundance()

    Assign a color to each node depending of the relative abundance.

    log2fc()

    Quantifies and compares Log Fold Change value between chosen layers.

    ml_TaxGroup()

    Assigns the taxonomic membership of the nodes.

    ml_properties()

    Quantifies different topological properties of a multilayer network.

    net_inference()

    Allows to infer a co-abundance network from an abundance table.

    net_plot()

    Creates a graph of the network.

    node_color_mat()

    Create a matrix that contains the assigned colors for the nodes of a multilayer network.

    phyl_ctr_df()

    Creates a data.frame of the sums of centrality values at a chosen taxonomic level.

    phyl_ctr_plot()

    Shows centrality importance of the phyla.

    slope_R2()

    Get the slope and R-squared of linear models of topologiclal properties*.

    v_colored()

    Assign a color to each node of a network depending of a certain taxonomic level, for example, the phylum.

    v_colored_ml()

    Assigns a color to each node of a multilayer network depending of their taxonomic level, for example, the phylum.
